snippet: Elaine Huguenin says a New Mexico law violates her right to free speech by making her celebrate something her religion tells her is wrong.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column examines New Mexico case in which photographer Elaine Huguenin is challenging law prohibiting businesses from discriminating against gays; notes that complaint was filed against Huguenin after she refused to document lesbian couple's commitment ceremony, and she argues that law violates her right to free speech by making her celebrate something contradicting her religion.
lead_paragraph: Elaine Huguenin says a New Mexico law violates her right to free speech by making her celebrate something her religion tells her is wrong.

headline.print_headline: Can Photographer Reject Gay Couple’s Request?
headline.main: Weighing Free Speech in Refusal to Photograph Lesbian Couple’s Ceremony

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
